title: Adverts - How do they work?
body:
If you asked me to define an advert. I would say an advert is a message designed to encourage viewers to take a particular action.  Now, what makes an advert effective? Simply having a message is not enough. I have learnt that positioning /placement matters a lot. Where you place the advert is the biggest factor that influences the effectiveness of an advert. Another factor that affects the effectiveness of an advert is frequency.

Think about it for a minute... How any times did you take an action based on an advert you saw for the first time? I am willing to bet that most of us didn't take any action the first time. However, after seeing the advert a couple of times, say 5 - 10 times, it begins to sink in, and then boom! the magic happens. The advertisers have succeeded in getting your attention.

I know this is true because I did a small experiment on my comedy site www.naijalol.com where I wanted to promote my second website www.naijamuuzic.com. First, I put an ad on the home page of NaijaLOL and displayed it to 80% of my visitors. I thought this was a good position for the advert but to my greatest surprise, I wasn't getting the kind of hit I expected from the advert. This got me questioning the advert's message. Like, was the message not clear enough? Was the ad just not just appealing enough? etc.

Then I decided to place the same ad with the same message on another page on NaijaLOL, this time I decided to place it on the page where users watched videos.. and boom! I started seeing activities and within the first day I saw 15 clicks compared to the 2 clicks I saw from the first advert.

The lesson here is to embrace experiments when it comes to advertisement. If your ad is not working as you expect it to. Check the following things:

  1. Position - Is the ad placed on a page where visibility is high. In my case, I learnt that users don't spend any significant time on the home page. Instead they just find a video of interest and go straight to watching it. Most of the time spent on the home page is spent looking for an item of interest
  2. Frequency - Am I displaying the ad frequent enough?
  3. Message - Is the message clear enough? Is it appealing?
